cab.content: CONFIDENTIALUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HER BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENTCOFY NO g()CABINET13thionsCONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the Cabinetheld at 10 Downing Street onWEDNESDAY 26 MARCH 1980at 9. 30 amPRESENTThe Rt Hon Margaret Thatcher MPPrime MinisterHon William Whitelaw MPry of State for the Home DepartmentHon Lord Car ringtonry of State for Foreign andwealth AffairsHon Sir Keith Joseph MPry of State for IndustryHon Sir Ian Gilmour MPfivy SealHon Michael He seltine MPry of State for the EnvironmentHon Nicholas Edwards MPry of State for WalesHon Patrick Jenkin MPry of State for Social ServicesHon John Nott MPry of State for TradeHon Mark Carlisle QC MPry of State for Education and ScienceThe Rt Hon Lord Hail shamLord ChancellorThe Rt Hon Sir Geoffrey Howe QC MPChancellor of the ExchequerThe Rt Hon James Prior MPSecretary of State for EmploymentThe Rt Hon Peter Walker MPMinister of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food1The Rt Hon George Younger MPSecretary of State for ScotlandThe Rt Hon Humphrey Atkins MFSecretary of State for Northern IrelandThe Rt Hon Norman St Jobn-Stevas MPChancellor of the Duchy of LancasterThe Rt Hon David Howell MPSecretary oi State for EnergyThe Rt Hon John Biffen MPChief Secretary, TreasuryThe Rt Hon Angus Maude MPPaymaster GeneraliCONFIDENTIAL CONFIDENTIALTHE FOLLOWING WERE ALSO PRESENTHon Norman Fowler MP The Rt Hon Michael Jopling MPit of Transport Parliamentary Secretary, TreasuryEarl FerrersMinister of State, Ministry ofAgriculture, Fisheries and FoodSECRETARYSir Robert ArmstrongSUBJECTTHE BUDGETiiCONFIDENTIAL CONFIDENTIALWeT THE CHANCELLOR OF THE EXCHEQUER informed the Cabinetof the proposals in his forthcoming Budget.In accordance with precedent details are not recorded in theCabinet Conclusions.Cabinet Office26 March 1980CONFIDENTIAL
